metadata.title: CVE-2023-0225 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in Samba. An incomplete access check on dnsHostName allowsauthenticated but otherwise unprivileged users to delete this attributefrom any object in the directory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0225` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29
libnss-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29
libpam-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29
libsmbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29
libwbclient0 - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29
python-samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29
registry-tools - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29
samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29
samba-common - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29
samba-common-bin - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29
samba-libs - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29
samba-testsuite - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29
smbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29
winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.29').
